org.gvsig.gpe.xml.stream
Interface IXmlStreamWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
StaxXmlStreamWriter
public interface IXmlStreamWriter

IXmlStreamWriter defines an "XML push" like streaming API for writing XML documents encoded as per the OGC Binary XML Best Practices document.

This interface does not defines setter methods to control encoding behavior such as byte order to use or character encoding. A IXmlStreamWriter instance is meant to be already configured with the desired encoding options when returned from the BxmlOutputFactory.

Sample usage: 

 
 BxmlOutputFactory factory = BxmlFactoryFinder.newOutputFactory();
 IXmlStreamWriter writer = factory.createSerializer(inputStream);
 
 writer.setSchemaLocation("http://www.example.com", "http://www.example.com/schema.xsd");
 
 writer.writeStartDocument();
 
 writer.setPrefix("ex", "http://www.example.com")
 writer.setDefaultNamespace("http://www.anotherexample.com");
 
 writer.writeStartElement("", "root");
 
 writer.writeStartElement("http://www.example.com", "child");
 
 //child attributes list...
 writer.writeStartAttribute("http://www.example.com", "att");
 writer.writeValue("attValue");
 writer.writeStartAttribute("http://www.example.com", "emptyAtt");
 writer.writeEndAttributes();
 
 //child value as a purely streamed int array
 writer.startArray(EventType.VALUE_INT, 10);
 for(int i = 0; i < 10; i++){
   writer.writeValue(i);
 }
 writer.endArray();
 
 writer.writeComment("interleaved value type follow");
 
 writer.writeValue("10 11 12 13");
 
 writer.writeEndElement(); // child
 writer.writeEndElement(); // root
 writer.writeEndDocument();

Since:
1.0
Version:
$Id: IXmlStreamWriter.java 21945 2008-06-30 14:04:53Z jpiera $

Method Detail

getLastEvent

EventType getLastEvent()
Returns the event corresponding to the last write call.

For example, if the last write call was writeStartElement it shall return START_ELEMENT, if it was writeStartAttribute, ATTRIBUTE, etc.

Returns:
EventType.NONE if writing has not yet started (ie, writeStartDocument has not been called), the event for the last write operation otherwise.

getLastTagEvent

EventType getLastTagEvent()
Returns:
null if no tag event has been written yet, START_ELEMENT or END_ELEMENT otherwise, depending on which of them was lately called

getTagDeep

int getTagDeep()
Returns:
how deep is the current element tree

close

void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes this stream writer and releases any system resources associated with it, including the underlying output stream or any other output source it may be operating upon.

A call to this method implies a flush of any possible buffered wtrite before closing the stream.

The first call to this method closes and releases resources. Subsequent calls shall take no effect and return quitely. After the first call to this method any non query method (defined as metadata retrieval methods in the class' javadoc) shall fail with an io exception.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

isOpen

boolean isOpen()
Returns whether this stream writer and its underlying output source are open and able to receive more write calls.

A IXmlStreamWriter should be open since its creation until close() is explicitly called by client code.

Returns:
true if this stream is still open, false otherwise

flush

void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
Write any cached data to the underlying output mechanism.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

schemaLocationUri -

writeStartDocument

void writeStartDocument()
                        throws java.io.IOException
Initiates the encoding of an XML formatted document in the BXML encoding.

This should be the first non query method to call after a stream writer is created. The implementation will use the call to this method to write down the document header and xml declaration.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeEndDocument

void writeEndDocument()
                      throws java.io.IOException
Finishes up encoding a BXML document.

Implementations shall use this method to write down the document's trailer token.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeStartElement

void writeStartElement(java.lang.String namespaceUri,
                       java.lang.String localName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Parameters:
namespaceUri - the namespace uri for the element
localName - the elements non qualified (local) name
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeStartElement

void writeStartElement(javax.xml.namespace.QName qname)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Parameters:
qname - qualified element name. Only namespace and localName are relevant. Prefix, if present, is ignored. The currently mapped prefix for the namespace will be used in any case.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
setPrefix(String, String)

                     throws java.io.IOException

writeStartAttribute

void writeStartAttribute(java.lang.String namespaceUri,
                         java.lang.String localName)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Starts writting an xml attribute.

Writting an attribute and its value is split in two parts. This method only stand for the attribute declaration. Writting an attribute value is made after calling this method and is optional. The attribute value can be done with any of the writeValue methods, even using various writeValue calls for the same attribute.

After the last element attribute has been written, writeEndAttributes() shall be called to indicate the end of the attribute list.

Sample usage: 
 
 writer.startAttribute("", "att1");
 writer.writeValue("value1");
 writer.writeValue(1);
 writer.writeValue(2);
 writer.writeValue(3);
 writer.startAttribute("", "att2");
 writer.writeValue(1.0L);
 ...
 writer.writeEndAttributes();

Parameters:
namespaceUri - not null
localName - not null
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
writeEndAttributes()

writeStartAttribute

void writeStartAttribute(javax.xml.namespace.QName qname)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Starts writing an xml attribute for the given qualified name.

Parameters:
qname - a QName where to get the namespace uri and local name for the attribute
Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
writeStartAttribute(String, String)

writeEndAttributes

void writeEndAttributes()
                        throws java.io.IOException
Indicates there are no more element attributes to encode for the current element.

This method is useful for the encoder to recognize (and write down the appropriate tokens) the following potential call to some writeValue method corresponds to the element's contents and not to the current attribute value.

Sample usage: 
 
 writer.startElement("", "element");
 writer.startAttribute("", "att1");
 writer.writeValue("value1");
 writer.startAttribute("", "att2");
 writer.writeValue(1.0L);
 ...
 writer.writeEndAttributes();
 writer.value("element value");
 ...

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeComment

void writeComment(java.lang.String commentContent)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Writes a comments block

The provided commentContent is the coalesced value of the equivalent XML comment block (enclosed between <!-- and --> tags.

Parameters:
commentContent - the coallesced value of the comment section
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setDefaultNamespace

void setDefaultNamespace(java.lang.String defaultNamespaceUri)
                         throws XmlStreamException
Binds a URI to the default namespace for the current context.

This URI is bound in the scope of the current START_ELEMENT / END_ELEMENT pair. If this method is called before a START_ELEMENT has been written the uri is bound in the root scope.

Parameters:
defaultNamespaceUri - the uri to bind to the default namespace, may be null
Throws:
XmlStreamException

setPrefix

void setPrefix(java.lang.String prefix,
               java.lang.String namespaceUri)
               throws XmlStreamException
Sets the prefix the uri is bound to, for the current context.

This prefix is bound in the scope of the current START_ELEMENT / END_ELEMENT pair (current context). If this method is called before a START_ELEMENT has been written the prefix is bound in the root scope.

Parameters:
prefix -
namespaceUri -
Throws:
XmlStreamException

getValueLength

long getValueLength()
Returns:
the length of the current value being written.

getWrittenValueCount

long getWrittenValueCount()
Returns:
how many elements has already being written for the current value
